dt: {bc}an injurious, unfair, or unjust act {bc}action or conduct inflicting harm without due provocation or just cause
{bc}a violation or invasion of the legal rights of another
{bc}principles, practices, or conduct contrary to justice, goodness, equity, or law
{bc}the state, position, or fact of being or doing wrong: such as
{bc}the state of being mistaken or incorrect

pt: {sc}injustice{/sc} {sc}injury{/sc} {sc}wrong{/sc} {sc}grievance{/sc} mean an act that inflicts undeserved hurt. {sc}injustice{/sc} applies to any act that involves unfairness to another or violation of one's rights.

pt.t: the {it}injustices{/it} suffered by the lower classes

pt: {sc}injury{/sc} applies in law specifically to an injustice for which one may sue to recover compensation.
{sc}wrong{/sc} applies also in law to any act punishable according to the criminal code; it may apply more generally to any flagrant injustice.
{sc}grievance{/sc} applies to a circumstance or condition that constitutes an injustice to the sufferer and gives just ground for complaint.

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}wrang{/it}, from {it}*wrang{/it}, adjective, wrong
shortdef: an injurious, unfair, or unjust act : action or conduct inflicting harm without due provocation or just cause
a violation or invasion of the legal rights of another; especially : tort
something wrong, immoral, or unethical; especially : principles, practices, or conduct contrary to justice, goodness, equity, or law

pt: {sc}wrong{/sc} {sc}oppress{/sc} {sc}persecute{/sc} {sc}aggrieve{/sc} mean to injure unjustly or outrageously. {sc}wrong{/sc} implies inflicting injury either unmerited or out of proportion to what one deserves.

pt.t: a penal system that had {it}wronged{/it} him

pt: {sc}oppress{/sc} suggests inhumane imposing of burdens one cannot endure or exacting more than one can perform.

pt.t: a people {it}oppressed{/it} by a warmongering tyrant

pt: {sc}persecute{/sc} implies a relentless and unremitting subjection to annoyance or suffering.
{sc}aggrieve{/sc} implies suffering caused by an infringement or denial of rights.

pt.t: a legal aid society representing {it}aggrieved{/it} minority groups

shortdef: to do wrong to : injure, harm
to treat disrespectfully or dishonorably : violate

meta.id: two wrongs don't make a right
stems: two wrongs don't make a right

hwi.hw: two wrongs don't make a right

dt: used to say that if one person hurts another person, the hurt person should not do something hurtful in return

shortdef: —used to say that if one person hurts another person, the hurt person should not do something hurtful in return
